actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on March 23, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Santos moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House observed a moment of silence in rememberance of the Honorable Patricia Schroeder.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 404
actions-list.actionItem: 7 (Roll no. 145).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1159 — "To amend the Taiwan Assurance Act of 2020 to require periodic reviews and updated reports relating to the Department of State's Taiwan Guidelines."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 393
actions-list.actionItem: 4 (Roll no. 144).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1093 — "To direct the Secretary of State to submit to Congress a report on implementation of the advanced capabilities pillar of the trilateral security partnership between Australia, the United Kingdom, and the United States."

The Chair announced that the unfinished business was on the question on motions to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 1093 and H.R. 1159, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings has been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 22.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 P.M. today.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 25.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Steil moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution. H. Con. Res. 25 — "Authorizing the use of Emancipation Hall in the Capitol Visitor Center for a ceremony as part of the commemoration of the days of remembrance of victims of the Holocaust."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 406.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Wagner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 406 — "To provide for the treatment of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations as an international organization for purposes of the International Organizations Immunities Act, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1159.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Wagner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1159 — "To amend the Taiwan Assurance Act of 2020 to require periodic reviews and updated reports relating to the Department of State's Taiwan Guidelines."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1093.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. McCaul moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1093 — "To direct the Secretary of State to submit to Congress a report on implementation of the advanced capabilities pillar of the trilateral security partnership between Australia, the United Kingdom, and the United States."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 22.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S. 30.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 22.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is shceduled for 2:00 p.m. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Marcus J. Molinaro to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
